intro: Anisolobus stadelmeyeri, commonly known as the Stadelmeyer's anisolobus, is a rare and unusual plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in temperate regions with cool climates. It has a short stem and produces small, round fruits known as schizocarps. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
